newsitem.title: JAPAN: GKN likely to be delisted on June 7 - TSE.
newsitem.headline: GKN likely to be delisted on June 7 - TSE.

text.p: The Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSE) said on Thursday that Britain's GKN Plc was likely to be delisted from the exchange on June 7.
GKN said earlier that it had applied to delist its shares from the Tokyo bourse.
Its shares have been trading on the foreign section of the stock exchange since December 1988.
The number of foreign companies listed on the TSE has been falling since hitting a peak of 127 companies in December 1991, the TSE said in a statement.
Currently, 67 foreign companies are listed on the TSE, including U.S. firm Schlumberger which is likely to be delisted on May 10 and GKN, the stock exchange said.
